medical_history.chief_complaint: 2-day history of fever, sore throat, and burning sensations in fingers and toes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to presentation. The patient had experienced 3 similar episodes of respiratory infections over the previous 6 months, during which burning pain in fingers and toes resolved after several days of antibiotics without analgesics. Pain was noted to be variable and more severe during winter.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient's past medical history was otherwise uneventful.
medical_history.family_history: Mother reported recurrent episodes of pain in her fingers and toes mostly during febrile infections from the age of 15 to 25 years. Maternal grandfather died at the age of 23 with chronic renal insufficiency. Family had no other history of renal, cardiac, or neurologic disease.
